fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce on a fresh installation of Confluence

# Log in as the user.
# Set an avatar from the user.
# Create a personal space for the user.
# Verify that when viewing the personal space, the user's avatar shows up correctly
# From User Management, change the username to something else.
# Verify the personal space still shows the avatar.
# Change the personal space to use the documentation theme
# Verify the personal space now shows an anonymous avatar.

Renaming the user back to their original name will allow the avatar to show correctly in the documentation theme. Standard theme is not affected.

Logs do not show any errors relating to the user profile.

Changing the avatar after a rename will not resolve the issue. 

h3. Workaround

# Do not use the Documentation theme for the personal space.
# Rename the user to their original username
fields.summary: After renaming a user, the user avatar is anonymous in the documentation theme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32857].
  {panel}

When we send an edit notification for this page https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/What%27s+New

The email shows like this, when the images have not been modified at all. 

!WhatsNewEmail.png!

We've had a few customer complaints about this particular email (customers watch this page to be updated about what is coming up in OnDemand).  We'll probably move away from this solution very soon, but we should also fix whatever is going wrong in the notification too.
fields.summary: Page edit notification shows images have changed when they have not
allow Confluence admins to prevent WebDAV-incompatible characters in page names

fields.description:
The quick search box helpfully includes a label element.  The search provided on the search results page and in the search form produced by the livesearch macro does not include a label.

Without this, a screen reader won't make it clear that the input is a search form.

This is another gap that prevents Confluence from meeting the most basic required level of compatibility in the WCAG 2.0 standard.
fields.summary: Search and livesearch macro do not include a label element...

fields.description:
Other than stated in the help for the search, wildcards used at the beginning of a word don't work.

We are using Confluence 5.3.4, but this seems to be true for 5.4.3 as well.

This might not be an issue for many users, for us this is unfortunately a major drawback, as we use confluence to store technical documentations and make them available and we have conventions where only the first characters of names/terms differ and where we need to find all pages relating to such terms. 

E.g. we need a search like "?0DUMMYXY" or "*DUMMYXY" to list pages  relating to terms like 10DUMMYXY, 20DUMMYXY" etc.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

 1. https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Documentation+Home
 2. Search "confluence"
 3. Yields  884 results (correct)
 4. Search "c?nfluence"
 5. Yields 884 results (correct)
 6. Search "c*nfluence"
 7. Yields 884 results (correct)
 8. Search "?onfluence"
 9. Yield no results (incorrect)
 10. Search "*onfluence"
 11. Yield no results (incorrect)

*Workaround:*
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+To+Use+Wildcard+as+the+First+Character+of+a+String+on+Confluence+Search
fields.summary: Confluence Search: Wildcards at the beginning of a word do not work

fields.description:
JVM settings > 4GB memory store produce a Confluence crash when rendering PDF files with large images.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Configure a Confluence instance with > 4GB of memory
2. Attach [^Medusa.pdf] to a page and embed it in a ViewFile macro
3. Save the page and Confluence will crawl to a halt and crash

The bug's behaviour appears to be identical to the CONF-30711 bug.
The workaround from the CONF-30711 bug doesn't work.

*Possible Workaround* one of customers reported that upgrading java to version 7u55 stabilised the instance from the occurrence of crashes.
fields.summary: Confluence crashes when rendering from pdf Files with Bézier curves
Show more information when using @mention
Display custom field HTML as text link

fields.description:
If you copy some text with a contained link from one Confluence page in edit mode and paste it into another Confluence page, the link disappear. The formatting (blue, underlines) will still there but the link will not. h4.Steps to reproduce: # Create a page in Confluence. # Add some text and link it to a shared location like file://///192.168.10.115/MyShare. !img.PNG! (i) You can also use Confluence source code editor as below exacmple to reproduce this: {code}

sample link

{code} # Save it, and go to edit mode again. # Create a new page in a different tab. # Copy the link from page one and copy to page 2, you will see that the copied link will maintain the blue underlines, however it will not have the contained link. Note: This behaviour was reproduced in below Fire Fox versions 15, 26 and 27.
fields.summary: Links are stripped when pasting into the rich text editor while using Firefox

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32838].
  {panel}

* Ability to add more categories on the left (currently have "All People" and "People with personal Spaces")
** E.g. QA Team
** Database Team
*  Have more information to appear on the People Directory
** User Phone Number
** Team Name
** Department.
* Allow the customer to choose which information from profiles appears on the front of the People Directory
* This would allow anybody taking a look at People Directory to quickly see the layout of the company, i.e. which person is in which team
fields.summary: Ability to Customise People Directory
Make the Macro remigration job configurable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32832].
  {panel}

Yo guys!

Sorry to say thous hard words, but: Your editor sucks! No really, I like the concept of confluence, I like the way it is connected to JIRA and step for step every bit of our documentation is moving to confluence. 

BUT!

Writing an article, especially a technically one with a lot of code snippets, sucks! How can I write several lines of monospaces code?

Look here: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/2721576/demo.mov

Or even worse, just try to make a list and get the spaces right ... everytime!

The best thing you've done recently to improve the editing experience in confluence is the new _Page Layouts_ feature. I think the reason why it's so awesome, is that you can always predict what's going on, because it is clearly visible.

It's like the editor im using right now here in JIRA: If I wanna write {{some monospace}} I just put some of these brackets {} here and they are clearly visible until I hit the blue (preview) button down there.

This is predictable behaviour and this is why writing {{markdown}} is getting so much attention right now: Predictability instead of Microsoft Word.

So please Atlassian, add the best {{markdown}} editor of all times to Confluence and make you product score in its core discipline! 

!https://raw.github.com/dcurtis/markdown-mark/master/png/208x128.png!

Thanks, Markus
fields.summary: Add a markdown editor to Confluence
Add "String exportSpace(String token, String spaceKey, String exportType, boolean exportAll)" for XML/RPC

fields.summary: Cant create admin account, installation is blocked

fields.description:
I get the following screen when I try to link Confluence to Jira during the install process.  I tried to "delete" the app links and the jira user server connection to confluence and tried again, but alas the same problem.  When I tried to report a bug to atlassian, I got a 404 error....

    Skip to breadcrumbs
    Skip to header menu
    Skip to action menu
    Skip to quick search

Linked Applications
Confluence

    Quick Search
    Help


Oops - an error has occurred
logo System Error

A system error has occurred — our apologies!

For immediate troubleshooting, consult our knowledge base for a solution.

If you would like to receive support from Atlassian's support team, ask your Confluence administrator to create a support issue on Atlassian's support system with the following information:

    a description of your problem and what you were doing at the time it occurred
    a copy of the error and system information found below
    a copy of the application logs (if possible).

Your Confluence administrator can use the support request form to create a support ticket which will include this information.

We will respond as promptly as possible.
Thank you!

Return to site homepage...

fields.description:
I just accidentally spammed a group of people 3 times because I hit the share button 3 times.

The causes seem to be:
- Some lag in updating the pop-up window with new names added
- The button sort of looks disabled, so I clicked on it alot.
- Once the share but was hit, there was no clear confirmation that things were send. IIRC, it actually said error sending, so I hit it again a few times.

I figure if you need confirmation that this is a real problem, talk to your PMs as I had them on the share list.

Affects both the JIRA issues macro and when creating issues by highlighting text.

This probably affects the reporter field, and others.

It would be nice if these fields could default to 'automatic' when they're required.

fields.description:
I have created a summary page for status reporting for the project from various teams and i am using excerpts from their pages. Basicially, 

- setup excerpt in individual pages
- setup excerpt include in summary status page

I am having problems with some of the pages not returning the excerpts even though i followed the same process. I get a page not found error. The permissions are all correct and i checked them. Those individual pages with the excerpt macros exist. I have set this up for about 23 pages, 14 of them work correctly and the other 9 do not. Looks like i am hitting a tool bug somewhere. Please help.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32805].
  {panel}

We are a 125-person company (http://cdbaby.com) that owns a 100-person license for Confluence. We (myself in particular) love the product; we'd like to be able to give those 25 people wiki logins so they can love it too but, there is no way our team can justify paying for 375 licenses we will never use. 

I'm sure each of your salespeople are fielding this request multiple times per day, if you won't implement this for us, your loyal customers, do it for them! Just think how discouraging it must be to have to tell their customers 'No!' and turn them away day after day, I've got a lump in my throat just thinking about it... 

It would be best to be able to purchase licenses in 10-packs but, if that's too much trouble,100-packs would be at least reasonable and somewhat in line with our needs. :-) 
Thanks!
Chris
fields.summary: Need a more reasonable way to upgrade license count!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32799].
  {panel}

Currently,  you can JIRA issue from a Confluence page and vice versa. 
!sampleJIRA.png!

!ConfSample.png!

There should be an option or feature which allow a bidirection link which will  create a link in JIRA and Confluence side automatically.  This way, user do not need to manually create a JIRA issue macro in Confluence side  or create confluence link in JIRA side  if they wish to allow  visibility of the page and issue from both of the application.
fields.summary: Automatically insert JIRA issue macro in Confluence page after  the  page is added in JIRA issue links and vice versa

Support Incremental Synchronisation for Novell eDirectory

fields.description:
Steps to replicate:
 * Make sure the Mail server is configured
 * Create a page that contains image(s) and save the page
 * Watch the page
 * Edit the page as such it will send an email notification

After following aforementioned steps, open the email in Outlook 2010 and you should see something like following:

!outlook_issue.PNG|width=600!

If you open in Gmail (or other mail clients) in the browsers, the image is fully rendered as follow:

!image_open_in_email.PNG|width=600!
h3. Workaround

This issue does not occur if the image is embedded inside of a Confluence table.

The *confluence-email-notifications-plugin-x.x.x.jar* file can be [modified|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-edit-files-in-confluence-jar-files-103711179.html] to change the styling, or to hard-code a table around all content excerpts. These workaround steps were tested on a Confluence 6.15.4 instance:
 * Extract the contents of the *confluence-email-notifications-plugin-x.x.x.jar* file
 * Under the extracted folder edit the following files, found in the */templates/content/* folder:
 ** content-excerpt-pattern-1.0.0.soy
 ** content-excerpt-pattern-2.0.0.soy
 * Enter the HTML to place table tags around the inline context lines (example can be found in the JAR file)
 * Repackage JAR file
 * Remove the existing *confluence-email-notifications-plugin-x.x.x.jar* file from */confluence_install/confluence/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins*
 * Replace it with the customized JAR
 * [Clear the plugin cache|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-clear-confluence-plugins-cache-297664846.html], and restart Confluence

All content notifications will now be embedded within a 1 row 1 column table, and images should display without issue. This customized JAR includes the workaround: [^confluence-email-notifications-plugin-8.11.2.jar].
h3. Information

This issue can still be replicated in Confluence 7.4.0 with Outlook 2016

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32788].
  {panel}

When using a apache webproxy, after an upgrade, the server might return a 304 NOT MODIFIED and thus, won't reload the files after the upgrade.

A workaround for this is to manually delete all cache files from browsers to force the cache to be rebuilt (200 OK response), but this might cause a huge problem on a instance that has thousands of users.

There was one customer that recommended versioning of the resources so when an upgrade happens, the resources are downloaded automatically.

this link illustrates the suggestion:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9692665/cache-busting-via-params
fields.summary: Confluence should force a reload on all Browser caches after an upgrade

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32778].
  {panel}

There are currently two ways (that I know of) to create a new Jira issue from Confluence:

1) In Edit mode, use the Jira Issues macro to create a new issue.
2) Not in edit mode, select some text and click the Jira icon in the tiny menu that pops up.

These two methods present two different interfaces. Using the Jira issues macro, one must select from a non-filterable list of all possible projects. However, the UI will properly allow filling in values for required fields, as per CONF-23424.

Using the text-selection method, the associated UI has a very nice filterable project picker, but cannot create issues in Jira projects which have any customization of the required fields (such as Component, which is mandatory in our projects).

I would argue that these two should provide an entirely identical UX. (I also think they should fully implement CONF-23424 but that is, literally, a separate issue).
fields.summary: The interfaces for creating a new Jira issue via the Jira Issues macro and via text selection when browsing a page should function identically

fields.description:
h3. Step to reproduce:
# Set the language setting in User profile as Deutsch 
# Set language  in Confluence Admin > Languages as English.
# Create a Meeting Notes.

h3. Observed Result:
As you can see, some part of the meeting notes are in Deutsch  and some are in English.
!sample.png!


This issue affect other blueprint as well.

h3. Cause
The mismatch occurs when the user's language is different from the global language. In some places, the global language is preferred over the user's.

h3. Workaround
If it is feasible, ensure that the global language (Confluence Admin > Languages) is set to the same language as the end user's. The end user should also ensure that their browser language is set to their preferred language.
fields.summary: Mixed language in Confluence blueprints

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32776].
  {panel}

Customer addressed this:
{quote}
We'd like to use - the very common - default logical AND operator for searches of our content in Confluence.
Can't find a config option in Confluence to switch the default Lucene OR operator to AND.
Is this not configurable ?
{quote}
And it is related with https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-30974

Note:
The default search operator is OR although in [2006 we made AND available|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-5874].

This is not configurable though and it is an intended change to the searching algorithm. Due to the way that the phrase ranking works, it shouldn't be a problem though, because it should include all of the "AND" matches already, and they should be ranked the highest. What this means is the results will read like:
# All of the "AND" results appear first
# Results with less keyword matches will appear below, in order of how many keywords match, highest to lowest

Customer would like to have the option of AND/OR search.
fields.summary: Options to set search operator to AND/OR

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32762].
  {panel}

This may or may not be a duplicate of [#CONF-17621], about EXIF rotation, marked as "won't fix".  I understand from that issue that there is some debate about whether this is Confluence's issue or a browser issue.  Let me explain my experience.

# I take a picture with my iPhone, it displays it the correct way up
# I email it to myself, Gmail displays it the correct way up
# I accidentally import it into my Google Drive, it displays it the correct way up
# I download it to my Mac, it display it the correct way up
# I import it into Confluence, it displays it the wrong way round
# I start writing this ticket, and have an idea or two...
# I access it in Chrome using a file:// URI, it displays it the right way up
# I boot a Windows 7 VM and ping it over there, it displays it the right way up (perhaps a file:// URI in IE6 would be the nail in the coffin?)


{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of February 14, 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}

Hi All,

Thank you for your feedback on this issue thus far. This is certainly an issue which has done its round on the internet over the years for many browser and application vendors alike, with each pointing the finger at each other as to whether the application or browser should observe the EXIF rotation metadata.

The obvious solution is for all browsers to support the 'image-orientation' CSS, however after many years this is still only supported by Firefox.
We have explored no less than 6 different solutions to this issue as each brings pros and cons in terms of performance, behaviour and complexity.
As a result of this exercise, it has been decided that image rotation would be done server side based on the EXIF rotation metadata.

The actual implementation is somewhat different for Server and Cloud deployments, and thus the rollout/delivery may occur at different times, however is high up in the queue right now.

Confluence Product Management
{panel}
fields.summary: Image rotation of imported photographs is wrong

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32752].
  {panel}

For the sake of:
* Performance
* Troubleshooting
* Indexing bugs

...It can be desirable to have an option to not index the _contents_ of any attachments in Confluence. Our [current process|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+Do+I+Disable+Indexing+of+Attachments] to disable attachment index via disabling a number of extractors is an okay workaround, but does not disable indexing of ALL attachments. Text/HTML/XML files are still indexed and cannot be disabled via the UI. This presents problems since the Lucene upgrade in Confluence 5.2 introduces new bugs can hang the entire indexing process such as:
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-32566
* https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LUCENE-5400

However, even if the bugs (and other future Lucene bugs that may arise) are fixed, one may wish to forgo attachment indexing for the sake of improving Confluence performance.

This request is to add an option in the UI to simply disable all attachment contents. The permanent equivalent of issuing a POST request {{http://<confluence_url>/rest/prototype/latest/index/reindex}}
with {{Content-Type: application/json}} and form data {{option = CONTENT_ONLY}}.
fields.summary: Option in the UI to disable all attachment content indexing in Confluence
